title: Distribution of free house sites to Scheduled Caste/Other Economically Backward Classes

Objective: To provide free house sites to homeless poor Scheduled Caste people and other Economically backward class people at the ratio of 80:20 to enable them to construct their own houses
Eligibility: A citizen of India and a native or a permanent Resident of this U.T. of Pondicherry
Annual Family Income shall not exceed Rs.200000/
A homeless person and no member of the family own a house/house site.
Bona fide intention to construct house within a period of 2 years.
Required Documents / Enclosures with App: Caste/Income/Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority.

title: Grant of House Construction Subsidy to Scheduled Caste people.

Objective: Subsidy to poor houseless scheduled caste/Other Economically Backward class people to construct house

Bharath Ratna Rajiv Gandhi Housing Scheme for the grant of susidy for construction of house to the homeless SC/OEBC people. The subsidy amount of Rs.4,00,000/- is granted in 3 Instalments as follows: -
1st instalment of Rs.1,50,000/- on possession of vacant house site.
2nd Instalment of Rs.1,50,000/-
3rd instalment of Rs.1,00,000/- in first two instalment Rs.1,00,000/- building materials will be provided.
Eligibility: A Scheduled Caste person who is not possessing a house but having a house site of an area of 450 sq.ft to build the house and his annual income does not exceed Rs.2,00,000/-.
An OEBC person who is not possessing a house but having house site granted by Adi Dravidar Welfare Department and the Annual income does not exceed Rs.24,000/
Required Documents / Enclosures with App: Caste/Income/Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority.

title: Grant of financial assistance to poor S.C. pregnant & lactating women.

Objective: To provide financial Assistance to poor pregnant women and Lactating Scheduled Caste women.
Financial Assistance of Rs.12,000/- in cash as follows:
The pre-natal assistance shall be Rs.2,000 in cash per month for three months prior to the month of delivery.
The post-natal assistance shall be Rs.2,000 in cash per month for three months following delivery.
Eligibility: The applicant must be of scheduled Caste.
They should belong to the U.T. of Pondicherry by virtue of birth or continuous residence of not less than 3 years.
Should apply from 6 month of pregnancy and within 3 months from the date of delivery.
The annual income of the applicant and spouse should not exceed Rs. 200000/-.
Grant of financial assistance is made available only for 2 deliveries.
Required Enclosures with Application: Certificate issued by the Medical Superintendent of Maternity Hospital/Medical Officer in-charge of the Primary Health Centre, Sub-Centre or any other peripheral maternity /Health Centre of the Union Territory of Pondicherry.
Ration card, Aadhar card of both.

title: Financial Assistance for marriage of poor S.C. brides.

Objective: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the poor SC parents for performing marriage of their daughters.
Eligibility: Financial assistance at the rate of Rs.50,000/- (Rupees Fifty thousand only) in each case for the marriage of their two daughters.
Annual income of the parent/guardian shall not exceed Rs.2,00,000/-.
Financial Assistance shall not be received from other sources.
The Parent/Guardian of the bride should be a citizen of India and a native of Pondicherry.
The marriage shall be performed in accordance with the law.
Assistance is provided for the first marriage alone.
The Financial assistance is available only for two daughters in a family.
Attained the age of 18 years and 21 years for bride and bride groom respectively.
Application shall be submitted by the applicant 30 days prior to the date of marriage and within 60 days from the date of performance of the marriage.
Enclosures with Application: Proof of identity/copy of Aadhar card
Caste/Income/Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority.
First time marriage certificate obtained from MP/M.L.A/Commissioner of Municipality/Commune Panchayat.
Bank A/C details of the applicant.

title: Supply of dhotis and Sarees to S.C. people.

Objective: To provide clothing items to the all S.C. people of this Union Territory.
Eligibility: Each male member of the family is supplied with a lungi and shirt bit, and each female member is supplied with a saree and a blouse on two occasions i.e during Deepavali and Pongal festivals.
Whose names are included in the yellow/red ration card supplied by the Civil Supplies Department
Age shall not be less than 18 years.
Continuous residence in the U.T of Pondicherry for not less than 5 years.
Caste certificate from the competent authority.

title: Providing Civic amenities to Scheduled Caste areas.

Objective: The objective is to release Grant-in-aid to local bodies based on the project prepared by them for construction of water borne latrines in the S.C. colonies to facilitate them to live in hygienic conditions and providing civic amenities such as road water supply, side drain etc. Civic amenities such as roads, drainage, water supply, filling of low lying area, meeting current consumption charges for street lights, pathway to burial ground, construction of cremation shed and water borne latrines in the Scheduled caste predominant area. Construction of sweepers’ and scavengers’ quarters. The above services are provided through the PADCO/local bodies for which grant-in –aid is released to the PADCO/local bodies.

title: Financial Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Funeral Rites.

Objective: To provide financial assistance for performing funeral rites of the poor S.C. family members in order to get rid of the immediate hardship. Financial assistance of Rs.10,000/- (Rupees Ten thousand only) in cash
Eligibility: Applicant and Deceased must be SC
Annual Family income shall not exceed Rs.2,00,000/-
Family members of the deceased belongs to the U.T of Pondicherry by virtue of nativity or continuous residence of 5 years.
Enclosures with Application: Death Certificate,
Aadhar card of Deceased as well as the applicant.
Copy of ration card.
Community certificate.

title: Assistance under SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act.

Objective:
To provide immediate relief to the victims of S.C. atrocities.
Payment of relief, compensation for loss and rehabilitation.
Eligibility: Scheduled Caste person affected by atrocities.

title: Financial Assistance to construct Sanitary Latrine.
Grant of Retention Scholarship to S.C. Girl students.

Objective: Award of retention scholarship to encourage SC girls students to undertake Primary education and continue the studies without dropout. Rs.1,000/- per year to girl student studying from I to V Std.
Eligibility: No income limit
Nativity/Residence in this U.T for not less than 5 years
Enclosures with Application: Proof of identity
Caste/Income/Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority.
A copies of Bank A/c & Aadhar Card.

title: Award of Pre-matric scholarship to S.C. students.

Objective:
Award of Scholarship to scheduled caste students who are pursing elementary and secondary level of education continuously without hardship
 Rs.1,500/- per annum per student from VI Std to VIII Std.
Rs.2,500/- per annum per student from IX & X Std.
Eligibility: No income limit
Nativity/residence in this U.T for not less than 5 years.
Enclosures with Application: Proof of identity
Caste/Income/Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority.
A copies of Bank A/c and Aadhar Card

title: Award of opportunity cost to parents of S.C. girl students.

Objective: To financially assist the SC parents for sending school their daughters who otherwise earn livelihood for the family engaging themselves in menial labour.
Rs.3,000/- per academic year payable to the SC parent for each daughters studying in classes VI to XII standard.
Eligibility: No income limit
For girl students only.
Student should have been promoted to next higher class.
Enclosures with Application: Proof of identity
Caste/Income/Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority.
A copies of Bank A/c and Aadhar Card

title: Award of Post-matric scholarship to S.C. students.

Objective: This scheme is being implemented for the benefit of students who are studying at Post-matric level or Post secondary stage so as to complete their education. Admissable fee fixed by Fee Committee. Reimbursement charged by the institution and award of maintenance allowance for hostlers or day scholars.
Eligibility: Annual Income shall not exceed Rs.2,00,000/- ( Native or resident of U.T of Pondicherry for not less than 5 years..
Enclosures with Application: Proof of identity
Caste/Income/Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority.
Attested copies of qualifying certificates SSLC, +2 (HSc), Degree & Diploma etc., in respect of exam passed.
Copies of Bank A/c & Aadhar Card.

title: Grant of Dr. Ambedkar Financial Assistance studying in Professional Colleges.

Objective: Grant of Financial Assistance to origin SC student who have been sponsored by CENTAC for admissions under going Professional Course in Govt / Govt. recognised Pvt. College and also those origin SC student who have been admitted in Professional Courses run by Govt. Institution / collge of central / state/ U.T Govt. Reimbursement of admissable fees like Tuition fees & exam fees fixed by Fee Committee consulted by Govt of Pondicherry and Grant of maintenance allowance for hostlers @ Rs.20,000/ p.a and Day Scholars @ Rs.10,000/ p.a to origin SC Student.
Eligibility: No income limit
Nativity / Residence certificate
SC certificate of 1964 Act .
Enclosures with Application: Caste (1964) / Residence/ Nativity.
Mark list duly attested
Attested copies of Bank A/c & Aadhar Card
If Hostler original Hostel certificate

title: Award of adhoc merit grant (special incentive) to S.C. students.

Objective: Award of ad-hoc merit grant (special incentive ) to Scheduled Caste student who secure 65% or above marks in matriculation /SSLC Board of Examinations The scheme is implemented as a sort of encouragement for the S.C. students who secure 65% or above marks in matriculation/SSLC Board of Examinations One time cash award of Rs.1,000/-
Eligibility: No income limit
Certificate of Nativity//Residence of not less than five years in this U.T .
Enclosures with Application: Caste Certificate
Mark list duly attested
Residence / Nativity Certificate issued by the Revenue Officials
Copies of Bank A/c and Aadhar Card.

title: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Memorial Award to S.C. students.

Objective: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Memorial Award is granted to top ranking boy and girl student in each region (Pondicherry, Karaikal and Yanam) who have secured not less than 55% of marks in the aggregate in the Higher secondary Examination. Rs.15,000/- Cash Award.
Eligibility: No income limit
Mark list duly attested.
Nativity/Residence of not less than 5 years in this U.T
Enclosures with Application: Proof of identity
Caste/Income/Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority.
Mark list duly attested.
Copies of Bank A/c and Aadhar Card.

title: Reimbursement of college fees to deserving Scheduled Caste Students studying in Professional Colleges (TOP 20)

Objective: The scheme is to reimburse the tuition fees and examination fees paid by poor Scheduled Caste Students who have obtained Marks above 75% in Higher Secondary Course Examination and studying in Govt/Govt. recogonised private Professional colleges The scheme provides to the reimbursement of tuition fees and examination fees paid by poor S.C. students who have obtained 75% marks and above in Higher Secondary Course Examination and studying in Govt./Govt. recognized private Professional Colleges with a view to minimize their financial hardship.
Eligibility: Annual Income of parent – No limit
Find place in ‘Top 20 Rank’ in the HSC marks and selected through ‘CENTAC’ for admission in professional colleges.
Enclosures with Application: Caste/Residence Certificate issued by the Revenue Department
Certificate of Head of Institution
Original fee Receipt
Attested copy of HSC mark list.
A Copies of Bank A/c and Aadhar Card.

title: Award of Pre-matric scholarship to the students whose parents are engaged in unclean occupation.

Objective: To provide financial assistance for pursuing Pre-matric education whose parents are engaged in unclean occupation (Scavenger) To provide assistance to the parents of those children, who are engaged in unclean works like scavenger, Flayers & Tarner. Scholarship at the following rates irrespective of income and caste.
Rs.1850/- per annum to students studying in I to X Standard.
Eligibility: This kind of scholarship is being provided to the students whose either or both the parents are engaged in unclean occupation. (Scavanger)
Enclosures with Application: Certificate of unclean occupation obtained from the employer by the parent
A Copies of Bank A/c & Aadhar Card

title: Opening and maintenance of Boys and Girls hostels.

Objective: To providing boarding and lodging facilities to the S.C. students in pursuance of their education and to dissuade dropping of education at school and college level hostels facilities are provided. Providing boarding and lodging facilities to the Scheduled Caste students in pursuance of their education and to dissuade dropping of education at school and college level hostels facilities are provided
Free lodging
Free boarding
Cash payment in lieu of 2 pairs of clothing
Conveyance charges for 6 times (3 down and 3 up) in a year
Eligibility: No income limit for SC students.
Income of the parent /guardian shall not exceed Rs.75,000/- for OEBC students
Nativity/resident for not less than 5 years.
Parent/Guardian shall not live within the radius of 5 Km. from the hostel.
Enclosures with Application: Income, Caste / Residence/ Nativity Certificate issued by the competent authority.
Application should be submitted through the Welfare Officer of the hostel, study certificate.

title: Stipend to S.C. trainees in Technical Training Institutions

Objective: To give financial support to S.C. candidates/trainees who are undergoing training in Technical Training Institutions in Govt. Stipend is paid at the rate of Rs.170/- per month for the whole period of training
Eligibility: No income limit
Enclosures with Application: Caste / Nativity Certificate issued by the Competent Revenue Officials.
A copies of Bank A/c & Aadhar Card

title: Vocational Training

Objective: To enable SC school drop-outs to set up self-employment units in cutting and Tailoring ,training is imparted for a period of 12 months. No income limit
Age 18 to 30 years (Relaxable for widows) and Educational qualification VIII std or its equivalent.
Eligibility: Stipend at the rate of Rs.750/- per month is provided during the training period. One sewing machine with accessories is provided to each trainee on completion of successful training at free of cost.
